Title: Papaya
Description: Papaya fruit pulp and juice are rich in a specific type of enzyme called papain, which increases collagen production. collagen, in turn, is responsible for the elasticity and health of the skin. papaya contains vitamins a, c, e and antioxidants that help moisturize, nourish the skin and slow down the aging process.
Preparation_instructions: Preparation instructions for papaya:
Choose a ripe papaya: look for a papaya that is slightly soft when gently pressed. it should have a vibrant orange color and a sweet aroma.
Wash the papaya: rinse the papaya under cool running water to remove any dirt or impurities from the skin.
Cut the papaya in half: using a sharp knife, carefully slice the papaya lengthwise. the knife should easily cut through the flesh and the seeds in the center.
Scoop out the seeds: use a spoon to scoop out the black seeds from the center of the papaya. the seeds are not typically consumed.
Peel the skin: hold one half of the papaya firmly and use a vegetable peeler or a knife to remove the skin. repeat the process with the other half.
Slice or dice the papaya: once peeled, you can cut the papaya into slices, cubes, or any desired shape for serving.
Serving_instructions: Fresh papaya: place the sliced or diced papaya on a serving platter or individual plates. serve it as a refreshing and healthy snack or dessert.
Papaya salad: toss the papaya with some lime juice, a sprinkle of salt, and optionally, some chili flakes for a delicious and tangy papaya salad. serve it as a side dish or appetizer.
Papaya smoothie: blend the papaya with some yogurt, milk or juice, and a sweetener of your choice to make a creamy and tropical papaya smoothie. serve it in a glass with a straw.

Papaya salsa: combine the diced papaya with diced tomatoes, onions, cilantro, lime juice, and a pinch of salt to make a flavorful papaya salsa. serve it alongside grilled meats or as a topping for tacos or tortilla chips.
Papaya in fruit salad: add sliced papaya to a fruit salad along with other fruits like pineapple, strawberries, and grapes. serve it as a refreshing and colorful dessert or side dish.
Remember, fresh papaya is best enjoyed when it's ripe and sweet. adjust the serving suggestions based on your taste preferences and the specific recipe you choose to make. enjoy your papaya!

Title: Orange
Description: Orange contain vitamins a, b and high levels of vitamin c, a powerful antioxidant that neutralizes free radicals, prevents infections, cramps and vomiting, and is great for the health of your skin.the fruit of the sweet orange is a globular or oblong hesperidia 2-1/2 to 4 inches (6 to 10 cm) in diameter.

Preparation_instructions: How to make orange juice 5 steps?
To make orange juice with juicer, buy good quality oranges. ...
Peel the oranges.
Separate out the orange segments.
Add a few orange segments at a time in the juicer.
Collect the orange juice with juicer (hopper) in a jar. ...
Serve orange juice in juicer immediately.
Serving_instructions: Add the leftover juice after cutting to use in fruit popsicles.
Cut segments to make a pretty fruit salad.
Add sliced rounds to a fennel salad or apple salad.
Add wedges to a broccoli salad.

Title: Banana
Description: Large bananas contain about 121 calories.a nutritious and unique banana variety from india. the tall tree bears hefty clusters and each fruit is 8 to 12 inches in size.

Serving_instructions: How do you serve bananas as finger food?

Method. peel the skin and slice lengthways into four finger sticks. the sticks should be long enough for your baby to hold in their hand with the top of the banana sticking out. put the sticks on a plate so your baby can feed themselves.

Preparation_instructions: Peel the skins from the bananas by breaking the tip back and peeling skin in sections. peel in sections until all the skin has been removed. remove any white threads that remain on the flesh of the banana. cut the banana into slices to add to sweet or savory dishes.
Serving_instructions: Here are a few healthy breakfast ideas that include bananas:
Frozen banana bites with yogurt and nut butter.
Greek yogurt with bananas and chia seeds.
A protein smoothie with spinach, berries, and frozen banana.
Oatmeal topped with nuts, seeds, and sliced bananas.
Banana breakfast bars with nut butter, oats, and walnuts.

Title: Rice
Description: Highly fragrant rice has been a feature of bengali festivals, rituals and celebrations, and aged gobindobhog has almost attained legendary status.
PackagingMaterial: Packaging will be good there will be full safety of the product.

Preparation_instructions: Khichdi is basically a simple to cook, one-pot dish that is highly nutrient rich. bengalis take this one notch higher by using an aromatic gobindhobhog rice.
1.wash the rice repeatedly to remove the dirt and starch
2.spread the rice on a plate and allow to dry completely
3.in a wok or kadai, dry roast the dal for 4-5 minutes until a beautiful aroma fills the kitchen and the dal changes color
4.separate the dal in a bowl
5.wash the dal in cold water only once
6.in a wok, heat oil and fry the potatoes with a pinch of turmeric until the potato pieces of the bengali khichdi turn golden in color
7.separate the potato and proceed to fry the cauliflower florets in the same way
Serving_instructions: We should eat this type of rice immediately after cooking then only we can understand how delicious the rice is we show eat this through our own hands then we can feel the taste of this rice.

Title: Govindo bhog rice
Description: Gobindo bhog is a small grained white scented rice from west bengal. it has a sweet, buttery flavour with a wonderful mouthfeel. slightly sticky when cooked, it is used to make many bengali dishes. it is a key ingredient used for preparing offerings to govindaji or lord krishna and cooked especially on auspicious days. we have used gobindo bhog to make sweets, kheer and even risotto. because the rice sticks together, the consistency of the dish prepared is excellent. a definite must-try rice. once you use it, you will love it!
PackagingMaterial: We use quality approved packaging materials to pack our gobindo bhog grain rice and deliver to the clients within committed time frame.
Specialpackagingfeature: There will be total safety of the product.there will no chances of any damages.
Preparation_instructions: 1.rinse the gobindobhog rice thoroughly in cold water and let it soak for about 20-30 minutes.
2.in a pot or saucepan, add 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil.
3.drain the rice and add it to the boiling water.
4.add salt and ghee (if using) and stir well.
5.cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and reduce the heat to low.
6.let the rice cook for about 15-20 minutes or until all the water is absorbed and the rice is tender and fluffy.
7.turn off the heat and let the rice sit for 5-10 minutes before fluffing it with a fork.
8.serve the gobindobhog rice hot with your favorite curry or side dish.
Serving_instructions: We should eat this rice immediately after cooking then only we can understand how delicious the rice is and we should eat through our own hands then we can feel the taste.
